title: Lesson 143: A Walk Through the Woods

segments.text: Listen to the tape then answer this question.
segments.translation: 先听这段录音，然后再回答这个问题。

segments.text: What was so funny about the words on the sign?
segments.translation: 那个招牌上的文字有什么好笑的呢？

segments.text: I live in a very old town which is surrounded by beautiful woods.
segments.translation: 我住在一个非常古老的城镇里，这个城镇被美丽的树林环绕着。

segments.text: It is a famous beauty spot.
segments.translation: 这是一个著名的风景区。

segments.text: On Sundays, hundreds of people come from the city to see our town and to walk through the woods.
segments.translation: 每到周日，都会有数百人从城里来到我们这个小镇，然后漫步在树林里。

segments.text: Visitors have been asked to keep the woods clean and tidy.
segments.translation: 游客们被要求保持树林的整洁。

segments.text: Litter baskets have been placed under the trees, but people still throw their rubbish everywhere.
segments.translation: 虽然树底下已经放置了垃圾篓，人们仍然把垃圾扔得到处都是。

segments.text: Last Wednesday, I went for a walk in the woods.
segments.translation: 上周三，我去树林里散步了。

segments.text: What I saw made me very sad.
segments.translation: 我所看到的一切让我感到非常难过。

segments.text: I counted seven old cars and three old refrigerators.
segments.translation: 我数了七辆旧汽车和三台旧冰箱。

segments.text: The little baskets were empty and the ground was covered with pieces of paper,
segments.translation: 那些小篮子都是空的，地上到处是纸片、

segments.text: cigarette ends, old tyres, empty bottles and rusty tins.
segments.translation: 烟头、旧轮胎、空瓶子以及生锈的铁罐。

segments.text: Among the rubbish, I found a sign which said, 'Anyone who leaves litter in these woods will be prosecuted!'
segments.translation: 在那些垃圾中，我发现了一张告示，上面写着：“任何在这些树林里乱扔垃圾的人都将受到法律追究！”
